pyrh_redesign.order¶

class order.Order(instrument: instrument.Instrument, order_type: order.Order.Type, quantity: int, time_in_force: order.Order.TimeInForce = <TimeInForce.GFD: 1>, price: float = None, stop_price: float = None)¶

An order which a user can place.

Methods

__init__(instrument, order_type, quantity[, …])

Creates a new order.

__str__()

Return str(self).

place()

Place the current order.

cancel()

Cancels the current order after it has been placed but not yet executed.

status()

Returns the status of the current order.

Attributes

__init__(instrument: instrument.Instrument, order_type: order.Order.Type, quantity: int, time_in_force: order.Order.TimeInForce = <TimeInForce.GFD: 1>, price: float = None, stop_price: float = None)¶

Creates a new order.

Args:

instrument: the instrument tied to the prospective order a user creates. type: an enum used to represent the type of order the user will like to place. time_in_force: how long an order lasts before it is executed or expires. quantity: a discrete number of instruments included in the current order. price: a price amount corresponding to the instrument included in the current order.

Returns:

a new Order object.

__str__() → str¶

Return str(self).

place()¶

Place the current order. Calls _validate() before the order is placed. This method is idempotent so calling place() after the order has already placed will have no effect.

Returns:

An OrderStatus object outlining the status of the current order.

Raises:

MalformedOrderError: If the combinations of properties set on the order are not compatible.

cancel() → None¶

Cancels the current order after it has been placed but not yet executed.

Raises:

OrderCancellationError: If order has already been executed or terminated.

status()¶

Returns the status of the current order.
